description.narrative: The project aims to increase environmental education in the country and Involvement of CSOs in environmental monitoring as well as to improve environmental governance at local level,

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1.1 The number of established / supported environmental monitoring clubs at “green schools”. 1.2 The number of environmental monitoring trainings conducted as part of the project. 2.1 The number of CSOs involved in trainings on the green schools topics. 2.2 The number of green schools offering training according to the green schools programme. 2.3 The number of conducted trainings and the number of trained teachers on the green schools topics. 2.4 The number of designed/updated educational programmes on the green schools topics. 3.1 The number of partnership agreements between “green schools” and local government and self-government authorized to perform environmental monitoring in data collection and management, including the Hydromet. 3.2 The number of air quality monitoring reports prepared and submitted by “green schools” as part of the project. 3.3 The number of training sessions on environmental monitoring topics and the number of trained specialists. 3.4 The number of the visitors of resource centres for the duration of the project. 4.1 The number of activities for the dissemination of results conducted by CSOs as part of the project. 4.2 The number of consultations organized by the Aarhus centres a year. 4.3 The number of public environmental coordinating council meetings conducted for the project duration. 4.4 The number of CSO initiatives successfully implemented as part of the project. 4.5 The number of stakeholders involved in professional development activities as part of the project.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Lack of “environmental monitoring” clubs in 2016. 1.2 Zero environmental monitoring activities with public participation conducted as part of the project. 2.1 CSOs are not involved in the training sessions on the “green schools” topics. 2.2 140 schools are registered as the participants of the “Green Schools” Programme. 2.3 Zero trainings have been conducted and zero teachers have been trained on the “green schools” topics. 2.4 Educational programmes for the green schools are outdated and require updating. 3.1 The cooperation between the “green schools” and local government and self-government authorized to perform environmental monitoring in data collection and management is non-existent. 3.2 “Green schools” are not involved in environmental monitoring; 3.3 Zero training sessions on environmental monitoring topics have been organized as part of the project 3.4 There are no “green school” resource centres. 4.1 CSOs have organized zero awareness-raising activities as part of the project. 4.2 The Aarhus centres provide approximately 180 consultations a year. 4.3 The public environmental coordinating council conducts four meetings a year. 4.4 Zero initiatives have been successfully implemented as part of the project. 4.5 Zero stakeholders participate in capacity building activities as part of the project.

1.1 Development and publication of a guide on civic engagement in environmental monitoring. 1.2 Selection of CSOs and trainings on environmental monitoring for the volunteers - members of environmental clubs. 1.3 Organization of environmental monitoring clubs. 1.4 Opinion polls on environmental issues. 2.1 Basic training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools”. 2.2 Publication of guides and other materials for “green schools“. 2.3 Monitoring of “green schools”. 2.4 Expanding the "Green Schools" project to kindergartens and institutions for children with disabilities. 2.5 Updating the website dedicated to “green schools”. 2.6 Environmental camp sessions for the teachers and students of “green schools”. 3.1 Establishing of resource centres for “green schools”. 3.2 The purchase of equipment for the monitoring of air quality for “green schools”. 3.3 A training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools. 4.1 Further development of the network of Aarhus centres. 4.2 Grants for CSOs. 4.3 International cooperation and training. 4.4 Meetings of the Public Environmental Coordinating Council. 4.5 Support of the CSOs network in Belarus and their cooperation with government agencies. 4.6 Public relations, ensuring the dissemination of project results and project visibility.

1.1 A guide on civic engagement in environmental monitoring is developed, published and widely disseminated among the stakeholders all over Belarus. 1.2 CSO for development of educational programmes and organization of training on the issues covered by the Aarhus conventions is selected on the basis of the competition. Development of the education programmes is ensured. 1.3 Establishment of 7 environmental monitoring clubs, in 6 regions of the country and in Minsk, is ensured. 1.4 Opinion poll of civil servants, staff of business units, CSOs working in respective area, population and others to study their knowledge of the Aarhus Convention, environmental monitoring, etc. is organized. 2.1 At least three CSOs are selected in the result of competition and involved in the design of professional development programmes for pedagogues and teachers including distance education, and organization of education for them in the in the following fields: biodiversity, waste, water supply, energy and community actions. 2.2 Not applicable for the current planning period. 2.3 Methodology for monitoring “green schools” is developed. Monitoring over functioning of the network of "green schools" all over the country is ensured by the project staff, experts, other involved stakeholders, with at least 10 schools visited. 2.4 A kindergarten to operate as a model and a resource center for “green schools” is selected and approved by the PSC. Methodical recommendations on running of "green schools" program in kindergarten and proposed revision to "green schools" curriculum to ensure usage of the curriculum in kindergartens are drafted. Establishment of the National Rehabilitation Centre for Children with Disabilities in Minsk as pilot resource center for "green schools" program is ensured. Regulations on functioning of National rehabilitation Centre for Children with Disabilities as resource center for "green schools" are prepared and duly agreed with MNREP and Ministry of Education. 2.5 Web-site dedicated to "green schools" is established and launched. In the course of establishment of the web-site existing site www.greenlogic.by is used as reference material. Information on the projects previously implemented by UNDP and funded by the EU containing at greenlogic.by are kept as archive materials. 2.6 Establishment of a pilot resources center of "green schools" for summer recreation camps at "Zubryonok" and "Nadezhda" children's health-improving centres, and pilot resource center for rural "green schools" at the Centre for Folk Arts and Crafts in Kopys is ensured. Regulations on functioning of children's health-improving centres "Zubryonok" and "Nadezhda" and Centre for Folk Arts and Crafts in Kopys as resource centres for "green schools" are prepared and duly agreed with MNREP and Ministry of Education. 3.1 Establishment of 11 resources centres for "green schools" is ensured 3.2 List of equipment for monitoring of air quality and demonstration equipment for displaying the findings of the monitoring for the resources centres for "green schools" is prepared, agreed by the beneficiaries, and approved by the PSC. 3.3 Development of a guide for the "green schools" on methodology of performing environmental monitoring for the “green schools” without using complex equipment, and with particular attention to the quality of atmospheric air. 4.1 Further development of the network of Aarhus centres is ensured. 4.2 Regulations on the Call for Proposals are developed and agreed by the PSC. Call for Proposals is announced and completed. 4.3 2 staff of the existing Aarhus Centres increased their knowledge on functioning of Aarhus centres in European countries and involvement of public and civil society organizations into environmental decision- making through study tour to one of EU countries. 4.4 Issues of functioning of PECC and changes to the composition of the PECC are discussed with at least 15 participants during at least one meeting of the Public Environmental Coordination Council under auspices of the MNREP. The meeting is held in one of the Reserves or the pilot site where EU projects were implemented (venue to be defined later). 4.5 50 participants are trained on ecologically friendly way of living, ecological labelling, social entrepreneurship at the conference on development of environmental friendliness organized by CSOs as preparation for the Forum of CSOs planned for 2019. List of participants includes different stakeholders such as state institutions, business, NGOs, etc. 4.6 PR Specialist is recruited. Communication strategy of the project is developed and agreed by UNDP, the EU and MNREP. Visibility items in line with the EU requirements are produced for each event organized within the project, including bags, pens, notepads, etc. PR action on development of "green schools" network in Belarus is held for 40 participants. The program and venue of the action will be defined at later stage.

1.1 Development and publication of a guide on civic engagement in environmental monitoring. 1.2 Selection of CSOs and trainings on environmental monitoring for the volunteers - members of environmental clubs. 1.3 Organization of environmental monitoring clubs. 1.4 Opinion polls on environmental issues. 2.1 Basic training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools”. 2.2 Publication of guides and other materials for “green schools“. 2.3 Monitoring of “green schools”. 2.4 Expanding the "Green Schools" project to kindergartens and institutions for children with disabilities. 2.5 Updating the website dedicated to “green schools”. 2.6 Environmental camp sessions for the teachers and students of “green schools”. 3.1 Establishing of resource centres for “green schools”. 3.2 The purchase of equipment for the monitoring of air quality for “green schools”. 3.3 A training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools. 4.1 Further development of the network of Aarhus centres. 4.2 Grants for CSOs. 4.3 International cooperation and training. 4.4 Meetings of the Public Environmental Coordinating Council. 4.5 Support of the CSOs network in Belarus and their cooperation with government agencies. 4.6 Public relations, ensuring the dissemination of project results and project visibility.
